facts.text: The only president to be elected unanimously (twice).
He did not have wooden teeth; they were made of ivory, gold, and human teeth.
He refused to shake hands, preferring a formal bow.
The only president who didn't live in the White House (it wasn't built yet).
He was an avid dog lover and coined names like 'Sweetlips' and 'Drunkard'.
The first president to live in the White House.
He defended the British soldiers involved in the Boston Massacre.
He died on July 4th, the same day as Thomas Jefferson.
His last words were 'Thomas Jefferson survives' (he was wrong; Jefferson had died hours earlier).
He spoke 6 languages and was an architect, musician, and inventor.
He wrote the Declaration of Independence.
Doubled the size of the US with the Louisiana Purchase.
He introduced macaroni and cheese to the United States.
He kept two grizzly bear cubs on the White House lawn.
The shortest president (5'4" and 100 lbs).
Known as the 'Father of the Constitution'.
The White House was burned down by the British during his presidency.
His face appeared on the $5,000 bill.
The last of the 'Founding Fathers' to serve as president.
He ran unopposed for his second term.
Established the 'Monroe Doctrine' (telling Europe to stay out of the Americas).
Like Adams and Jefferson, he also died on July 4th.
The first son of a president to become president.
He enjoyed skinny-dipping in the Potomac River every morning.
He kept a pet alligator in the White House bathtub.
After being president, he went back to serve in Congress for 17 years.
He survived the first assassination attempt on a US president.
He beat the would-be assassin with his cane.
His pet parrot 'Poll' had to be removed from his funeral for swearing.
He fought in over 100 duels.
He appears on the $20 bill, despite hating paper money.
The first president born a US citizen (previous ones were British subjects).
English was his second language; he spoke Dutch at home.
His nickname 'Old Kinderhook' (O.K.) is why we say 'OK' today.
His autobiography doesn't mention his wife once.
Gave the longest inaugural address in history (nearly 2 hours).
Served the shortest term (died of pneumonia after 31 days).
He was the first president to die in office.
His campaign slogan was 'Tippecanoe and Tyler Too'.
Dubbed 'His Accidency' because he took over after Harrison died.
He had 15 children, the most of any president.
He was expelled from his own political party while president.
He later joined the Confederacy during the Civil War.
Promised to serve only one term, did exactly what he said, and retired.
Expanded the US more than any other president (Texas, Oregon, California).
He worked so hard he died 3 months after leaving office.
He was the first 'Dark Horse' candidate (unexpected winner).
A war hero known as 'Old Rough and Ready'.
He never voted in an election until his own.
Died after eating too many cherries and drinking cold milk.
His horse grazed on the White House lawn.
The last president from the Whig party.
He installed the first library in the White House.
He refused an honorary degree from Oxford because he couldn't read Latin.
Queen Victoria said he was the most handsome man she'd ever seen.
Did not swear on the Bible, but 'affirmed' his oath on a law book.
Arrested for running over a woman with his horse (charges dropped).
Widely considered one of the worst presidents due to escalating tension.
He installed the first central heating in the White House.
The only president to remain a bachelor his entire life.
He had one eye near-sighted and one far-sighted, causing a head tilt.
The Civil War began shortly after he left office.
He regularly bought slaves in Washington D.C. just to free them.
He is the tallest president in US history at 6'4".
He is enshrined in the Wrestling Hall of Fame (only lost 1 match out of ~300).
He stored important documents inside his tall stovepipe hat.
He was the first president to be assassinated.
He created the Secret Service hours before his death.
He was a tailor by trade and made his own suits as president.
He was the first president to be impeached.
He never attended school; his wife taught him how to read and write.
He was buried wrapped in a US flag with a copy of the Constitution under his head.
The 'S' in his name didn't stand for anything; it was a clerical error.
He was given a speeding ticket for riding his horse too fast in D.C.
He smoked about 20 cigars a day, which eventually caused his throat cancer.
He couldn't stand the sight of blood (despite being a General) and ate his steaks burnt to a crisp.
He installed the first telephone in the White House.
His phone number was simply '1'.
He banished alcohol from the White House (his wife was nicknamed 'Lemonade Lucy').
He won the election by only one electoral vote in a highly contested race.
He could write Latin with one hand and Greek with the other simultaneously.
He served only 200 days before dying from an assassin's bullet infection.
Doctors likely killed him by probing his wound with unwashed fingers.
He was a preacher before he was a politician.
He owned 80 pairs of pants and changed clothes several times a day.
He sold off old White House furniture (including Lincoln's) to buy modern decor.
He was a night owl who rarely went to bed before 2 AM.
His citizenship was questioned, with rumors claiming he was Canadian.
The only president to serve two non-consecutive terms (22nd and 24th).
The 'Baby Ruth' candy bar was named after his daughter, not the baseball player.
He personally answered the White House phone.
He had a secret surgery to remove a tumor from his mouth on a yacht.
He was the first president to have electricity in the White House.
He was so afraid of getting shocked he refused to touch the light switches.
He was the grandson of William Henry Harrison (9th president).
He gave the shortest inaugural address (if you don't count the words).
He always wore a red carnation on his lapel for good luck.
He gave his lucky carnation to a little girl moments before being shot.
His wife suffered from seizures, and he would cover her face with a handkerchief during state dinners.
He was the first president to campaign by telephone.
The 'Teddy Bear' is named after him because he refused to shoot a tied-up bear cub.
He was shot in the chest during a speech but continued speaking for 90 minutes.
He was the first president to leave the country while in office (Panama).
He went blind in one eye after a boxing match in the White House.
He was the youngest person to become president (took office at 42).
He got stuck in the White House bathtub and had to have a larger one installed.
He is the only person to serve as both President and Chief Justice of the Supreme Court.
He started the tradition of the president throwing the first pitch at baseball games.
He was the last president to keep a cow (Pauline) at the White House for milk.
The only president to hold a Ph.D. (Political Science).
He kept a flock of sheep on the White House lawn to trim the grass during WWI.
His face is on the $100,000 bill (which was never circulated).
He suffered a massive stroke, and his wife Edith essentially ran the country for the rest of his term.
He had the biggest feet of any president (Size 14).
He once bet and lost the White House china set in a poker game.
His administration was involved in the massive 'Teapot Dome' scandal.
He was the first president to speak on the radio.
Nicknamed 'Silent Cal' for being a man of very few words.
A woman bet she could get him to say 3 words; he replied, 'You lose.'
He slept about 10 hours a night and took 2-hour naps daily.
He had a mechanical horse installed in the White House for exercise.
He and his wife spoke Mandarin Chinese when they wanted to speak privately.
He had a pet opossum named 'Billy Possum'.
The Hoover Dam was named after him.
He was a self-made millionaire in the mining industry before politics.
The only president elected to four terms.
He was paralyzed from the waist down due to polio and used a wheelchair.
He was related to 11 other presidents (including his cousin Teddy).
He tried to hide his disability from the public.
He was the first president to appear on television.
The 'S' in his middle name doesn't stand for anything, but has a period anyway.
He installed a bowling alley in the White House.
He met his wife Bess in Sunday school when he was six years old.
He had a sign on his desk that said 'The Buck Stops Here'.
He was a Five-Star General in WWII before becoming president.
He loved golf so much he had a putting green installed at the White House.
He was an accomplished oil painter in his spare time.
He banished squirrels from the White House grounds for ruining his putting green.
He was the youngest elected president (43 years old).
He won a Pulitzer Prize for his book 'Profiles in Courage'.
He donated his entire presidential salary to charity.
He suffered from severe back pain and Addison's disease.
He installed a secret taping system in the Oval Office.
He owned an amphibious car and would drive guests into a lake to scare them.
He would often hold meetings while sitting on the toilet.
He was a teacher before entering politics.
He signed the Civil Rights Act of 1964.
The only president to resign from office.
He could play five musical instruments, including the piano and accordion.
He installed a one-lane bowling alley in the White House basement.
He spoke to astronauts on the moon via telephone.
The only president never elected as either President or Vice President.
He was a star football player at the University of Michigan.
He turned down offers from the NFL (Lions and Packers) to go to law school.
He worked as a fashion model in his youth.
He was a peanut farmer before becoming president.
He filed an official report claiming he saw a UFO in 1969.
He is the longest-living president in US history.
He sold the presidential yacht to save money.
He was a Hollywood actor and appeared in 53 films.
He loved Jelly Belly jelly beans and kept them on his desk.
He was the oldest president elected until Trump and Biden.
He broke the 'Curse of Tippecanoe' by surviving an assassination attempt.
He went skydiving for his 75th, 80th, 85th, and 90th birthdays.
He famously hated broccoli and banned it from Air Force One.
He was the youngest Navy pilot in WWII.
He is the second president to be the father of another president.
He is a talented saxophone player.
He won two Grammy Awards for spoken word albums.
His cat, Socks, received more fan mail than him for a while.
He claims to have watched every episode of 'My Little Pony' with his daughter.
He was the head cheerleader in high school.
He became an avid painter after leaving office.
He owned the Texas Rangers baseball team before becoming president.
He ran the first marathon by a sitting president (3 hours, 44 minutes).
He collects Spider-Man and Conan the Barbarian comics.
He won two Grammy Awards for audio versions of his memoirs.
He worked at Baskin-Robbins as a teenager and hates ice cream now.
His name means 'blessed' in Swahili.
He is left-handed.
He is the only president to have no prior military or government service.
He had a cameo in 'Home Alone 2: Lost in New York'.
He does not drink alcohol, smoke, or drink coffee.
He is a germaphobe and dislikes shaking hands.
He has a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
He overcame a severe stutter as a child by reciting poetry in a mirror.
He loves ice cream, especially chocolate chip.
He was one of the youngest senators ever elected (age 29).
He bought a puppy named 'Commander' for the White House.
He has visited the Amtrak station in Wilmington so often it is named after him.
